channel.title: The Thirsty Developer - Podcast
channel.description: A podcast with Microsoft Developer Evangelist's, Dave Bost and Adam Hoffman
channel.itunes:author: Dave Bost
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast with Microsoft Developer Evangelist, Dave Bost.
channel.itunes:summary: The Thirsty Developer podcast is hosted by Dave Bost, Developer Evangelist for Microsoft Corporation. Each episode Dave talks with various software developers, software architects and technologists about their passion in the software development industry.

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)

body.p: Dave and Adam are back after most hectic time of the year for a Microsoft Evangelist – fiscal year end. In this episode, we go off the tracks right out of the gate with a discussion of Adam’s recent trip to Disney World. After we gain traction, we muse on the many announcements coming down the pike for Microsoft developers with the recent enhancements to Windows Azure and the announcements from the Windows Phone 8 Summit.
(Note: portions of this program were edited out to protect little ears and their belief of a certain mythical creature with floppy ears.)
Dave Bost, http://davebost.com, @davebost
Adam Hoffman, http://stratospher.es, @stratospher_es

p.a: Meet the New Windows Azure (Scott Guthrie Blog Post)
Announcing Windows Phone 8 (Joe Belfiore Blog Post)

body.p: Adam is speaking at the Microsoft Cloud Summit: Windows Azure and Beyond on July 10th in Dallas, TX
Find Microsoft Technical Evangelist Events at http://msdnevents.com

p.a: Dungeons & Dragons Basic Set (Blue Box, c.1978)

body.p: Adam: Instructables, Marvel Heroic Roleplay Basic Game
Dave: GameInstitute.com

body.p: Subscribe via Zune Marketplace | Subscribe via iTunes

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)

body.p: After a long hiatus, the Thirsty Developer is back to kick off Season 2. In this episode, we introduce the listeners to a new member of the Thirsty Developer team, Adam Hoffman. Dave and Adam wax poetic about the old Commodore 64 days and learn about Adam’s role at Microsoft as well a hobby project of his – the Cloud Car (aka. Car-Puter).
Dave Bost, http://davebost.com, @davebost
Adam Hoffman, http://stratospher.es, @stratospher_es

p.a: The Commodore 64 and our favorite peripherals

body.p: Mike Benkovich’s Cloud Computer Soup to Nuts Webcasts

p.a: Windows Azure for the ASP.NET Developer Series
Clemens Vasters on the Azure Service Bus (Channel 9)

body.p: Books: Back of the Napkin (Dan Roam), Understanding Comics (Scott McLoud)

item.body:
In this episode, Clark and Larry pull up a bar stool in Madison with Developer’s Steve Evans and Lance Larsen to discuss the latest tips, tools and guidance around using JavaScript in your application development.
Show Notes
Madison .NET Users Group
JS Bin - an open source collaborative JavaScript debugging tool.
JavaScript compacting tools: SquishIt, Minify
IE9ify - jQuery Site Pinning plugin
QUnit - JavaScript testing suite
JSLint - JavaScript code quality tool
JSMock - Mock Object library for JavaScript
jQuery - JavaScript library
xkcd - Exploits of a Mom ("Bobby Tables")
Brandon Satrom's Blog
Twitter: @davebost, @csell5, @larryclarkin, @thirstyd
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD101.MP3
Subscribe via Zune Marketplace | Subscribe via iTunes

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)
item.body:
Show 100! After 3 years and some change we finally hit Show #100. In this episode, Larry comes back and joins Dave and Clark for the meta of all meta episodes. We take a look back at shows of the past, plan ahead for MIX and talk about innovation in the industry and what developers should do to keep up.
Show Notes
The Thirsty Developer 6: Project Euler - The first recorded (but not published) show
The Thirsty Developer 16: Dev-igners and Des-elopers w/Kevin Farner
The Thirsty Developer 25: The one with Joe Stagner
The Thirsty Developer 29: The iPhone Edition
The Thirsty Developer 38: Anthony Handley
The Thirsty Developer 61: I got nothing!
The Thirsty Developer 64: More on Powershell
The Thirsty Developer 66: HAML with a side of SASS
The Thirsty Developer 80: Meeting the New Guy, Clark Sell
The Thirsty Developer 88: Coding 4 Fun with Clint Rutkas
Twitter: @davebost, @csell5, @larryclarkin, @thirstyd
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD100.MP3
Subscribe via Zune Marketplace | Subscribe via iTunes

item.body:
After yet ANOTHER hiatus (holidays + work = no podcasts) and an operator FAIL on Dave’s part, Dave and Clark are back to discuss WebMatrix, Razor (the syntax) and NuGet. Also, Clark let’s us in on his upcoming travel schedule and Dave fetches the beer while he leaves Clark to his own devices. A little spoiler, it didn’t go well.
Show Notes
WebMatrix
Clark’s Web Camp Tour
Web Camps TV
Microsoft's Web Camps
Blog: Introducing “Razor” – a new view engine in ASP.NET (http://weblogs.asp.net/scottgu)
Blog: NuGet 1.1 Released! (http://haacked.com)
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD099.MP3
Subscribe via Zune Marketplace | Subscribe via iTunes

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)
item.body:
We're Back! After a little hiatus, Dave and Clark are back with special guest, Anthony Handley. In this episode we discuss how Silverlight is NOT dead, designing a lemonade stand, building a Windows Phone 7 app and did we mention… Silverlight is NOT dead.
Guest: Anthony Handley is the User Experience Practice Lead at Magenic. His focus is to create great digital experiences for the desktop and the web. With over 16 years working in interactive design and creative direction, he leads Magenic’s ux design team
Show Notes
PDC
Bob Muglia address his Silverlight comments
Scott Guthrie answers some Silverlight Questions
Clark shares his reflections
Adam Kinney
Building a Lemonade Stand in Expression Blend
GuestList WP7 app
Silverlight Firestarter event on Dec. 2nd
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD098.MP3
Subscribe via Zune Marketplace | Subscribe via iTunes

item.body:
In this episode, Dave and Clark lament about why podcasting is difficult, Expression Design vs. Adobe Illustrator, Windows Phone 7 versus the competition, Dave’s desire to learn how to build games, Silverlight for Embedded Devices and what the plans are for the Summer. As you can tell… it’s a show about nothing. Enjoy!
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD097.MP3

item.body:
In this episode, Clark chats with Microsoft Senior Program Manager, Barclay Hill. Barclay is a member of the Visual Studio development team responsible for the Database Project tools found in Visual Studio Ultimate. Here they chat about features such as versioning, refactoring, static code analysis and unit testing for your database.
Show Notes
Barclay's Blog
Starting Team Database Development (MSDN)
Forums: Visual Studio Database Development Tools
Xerox Case Study
Download the Visual Studio 2010 Ultimate Trial

VS Database Tools Team Blog

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)
item.body:
In this episode, Clark joins up with Mark Tinderholt of Avanade at the recent MIX conference to discuss putting Silverlight through it's paces in the Enterprise.
Mark let’s us in behind the scenes of a large project he is participating on in which the team is working to re-platform a large insurance system consisting of disparate systems, such as ASP.NET and Java, and how they’re pulling the system together using technologies such as Silverlight 3, WCF and Prism.
Show Notes
Mark on Twitter: @markti
Mark’s Blog
Prism (CodePlex project site)
MEF (CodePlex project site)
Prism and MEF (David Hill’s WebLog)
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD090.MP3

item.body:
In this episode, Clark sits down with Chip Aubry, lead technical architect from Tribal DDB. Here they discuss a recent project in which Tribal DDB created a web experience for McDonalds called the McNuggets Village that coincided with McDonald's Winter Olympics marketing campaign. Chip lets us in behind the curtain as he talks about how the project was implemented with technologies such as Silverlight, IE8 Web Slices and Azure.
Show Notes
Chip on Twitter: @caubry

item.body:
In this episode Dave and Clark talk with the mad scientist, Clint Rutkas. Clint talks us through what a day in the life looks like when you work on Coding4Fun and Channel9. From automated bartenders to dropping a thousand bouncy balls on your CTO’s head. It’s a wild and crazy show!
Show Notes
Are you new to Coding4Fun? The very first place to start is here. They are always looking for new and crazy ideas. Pitch the idea first but just don’t pitch any crazy LOB solutions.
Links
Here is a list of the different items we referenced during the show:
Clint’s Blog
Clint on Twitter
Coding4Fun @ PDC
Clint’s Groovy Dance floor
Tweetcraft
wiimote
ZWave ( specifically ControlThink )
Phidgets
Silverlight Media Framework (SMF)
Make magazine
Tip of the day: Never ever hook up AC into your USB port.
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD088.MP3
Subscribe via Zune Marketplace | Subscribe via iTunes

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)
item.body:
In this episode, we grab some time with Microsoft Architect Evangelist, Kirk Evans, to discuss the all important question, "When NOT to use SharePoint". The conversation leads to Kirk laying out some of the new enhancements in SharePoint 2010 as well as discussing the finer points of going from a pure ASP.NET developer to a SharePoint developer. Kirk also gives Dave and Clark a lesson on how one can ramp up quickly in SharePoint development with a list of great resources.
I apologize for the recording quality of this interview. We are still trying to work out the kinks with recording some of our interviews through Skype. Please bear with us.
Thanks!
Show Notes:
Kirk's Blog
Kirk on Twitter
Sites running SharePoint: Ferrari, Hed Kandi, Hawaiian Airlines
WSS Demo – Features web sites that are built using SharePoint (and it is built with SharePoint, too)
Randy Drisgill’s Blog on SharePoint Branding
Andrew Connell's Blog
MSDN Article: Understanding and Creating Customized and Uncustomized Files in Windows SharePoint Services 3.0
Book: Inside Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services 3.0
Book: Professional SharePoint 2007 Web Content Management Development: Building Publishing Sites with Office SharePoint Server 2007
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD086.MP3
Subscribe via Zune Marketplace | Subscribe via iTunes

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)
item.body:
After a search that spanned the globe, I am happy to introduce the new co-host of The Thirsty Developer, Clark Sell ( @csell5 ). Clark recently joined my team as a Developer Evangelist also based in Chicago, well he lives on the Wisconsin \ Illinois border so that is hardly Chicago.
Clark has been with Microsoft for over 4 years coming to the evangelist team from Microsoft Consulting Service. Having 12 years’ experience as solution architect, developer, tester, and product manager in the software industry, he’s mostly focused on Financial Services customers, line of business software and a quick jaunt through the halls of healthcare. Clark is also a Visual Studio Team System (VSTS) Ranger. You know that TFS check-in policy that stops you from checking in if the build is broken? You can thank him for that one. Clark is no stranger to podcasting as he has another podcast in which he co-hosts called The Smackdown on DeveloperSmackdown.com you can also read his blog at csell.net
Show Notes
Clark on Twitter
Clark’s Blog
Developer Smackdown Podcast
Download / Listen to the Show
http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD080.MP3

body.p: In this episode we sit down for a roundtable discussion with world renown speaker and author, David Chappell, and Paddy Srinivasan and Bharat Srinivasan of Cumulux to discuss their perspectives of the Windows Azure Platform and the shift to Cloud Computing.

We have a *Bonus* in this episode. Sometimes the conversation continues after the mics turn off. Sometimes those conversations are more insightful then the interview itself. Luckily I was able to grab my MicroTrack II and hit the record button to capture the continuing discussion. Stick around in the end as we’ve tacked this great discussion to the end of the episode.

Microsoft Research Code Contracts
IOC Containers: StructureMap, Ninject, Spring.NET and Unity
Thirsty Developer has a twitter feed, friend us at http://twitter.com/thirstyd

item.title: The Thirsty Developer 58: Applying SOA
item.description:
This week we have an interview with Chris Deweese, a software architect with REJIS about how they have applied SOA concepts and technology.  Chris also discusses some of the issues that they have had with SOA.  Our guest interview this week is Clint Edmondson, an architect evangelist based out of St Louis, MO.

Download / Listen to the Show

http://shows.thirstydeveloper.com/TD058.mp3

New Twitter Feed

Thirsty Developer has a twitter feed, friend us at http://twitter.com/thirstyd

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)

body.p: This week we talk with Mike Browne, an MVP on Windows Client Technologies about Windows Presentation Foundation. We also spend some time talking about Stream Oriented Computing and a WPF application that he built called flow..

MSDN Magazine Article on M-V-VM Pattern
Martin Fowler’s Presentation Model
Mike Brown’s Flow (early Beta)

item.dc:creator: ThirstyDeveloper@live.com (Dave Bost)

body.p: This week we talk about the future of managed languages with Mark Strawmyer, a Microsoft MVP in the C# language. Before we dive into the future of languages, Mark and Larry talk about the past, including a trip down memory lane to discuss Visual Basic with and without line numbers. After the interview Dave and Larry catch up and talk about their first and next programming languages.

Qbasic Gorillas Wikipedia Page (includes links to a Flash version of the game)
Unemployed Underscores
visitmix.com for MIX Keynotes
ClearRX – Deborah Alder’s keynote topic
Commodore 64 Manuals

Dave’s pick: MSDN Developer Centers (VB, C#, C++, etc)
Larry’s pick: Benkotips by Mike Benkovich
Thirsty Developer has a twitter feed, friend us at http://twitter.com/thirstyd

body.p: This week we talk about REST (Representational state transfer) style web services with Dan Rigsby, a Microsoft MVP specializing in connected systems (WCF and related technologies).

Original Definition of REST (from Roy Fielding’s dissertation)
REST Starter Kit – Preview 2 (Just released!)
JSON Definition (Wikipedia)
